verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, Where is the bill of your mother’s divorcement, whom I have put away? or which of my creditors is it to whom I have sold you? Behold, for your iniquities have ye sold yourselves, and for your transgressions is your mother put away.
verses.web: LORD says, “Where is the bill of your mother’s divorce, with which I have put her away? Or to which of my creditors have I sold you? Behold, you were sold for your iniquities, and your mother was put away for your transgressions.
verses.ct: The LORD says, "Show me the divorce papers proving I sent your mother away. Tell me — which creditor did I sell you to? No. You sold yourselves because of your sins, and your mother was sent away because of your rebellion."

verses.kjv: Wherefore, when I came, was there no man? when I called, was there none to answer? Is my hand shortened at all, that it cannot redeem? or have I no power to deliver? behold, at my rebuke I dry up the sea, I make the rivers a wilderness: their fish stinketh, because there is no water, and dieth for thirst.
verses.web: Why, when I came, was there no one? When I called, why was there no one to answer? Is my hand shortened at all, that it can’t redeem? Or have I no power to deliver? Behold, at my rebuke I dry up the sea. I make the rivers a wilderness. Their fish stink because there is no water, and die of thirst.
verses.ct: "Why was no one there when I came? Why did no one answer when I called? Do you think my arm is too short to rescue you? Do you think I lack the power to save? Look — with a single command I dry up the sea. I turn rivers into deserts where the fish rot and die of thirst."

verses.kjv: I clothe the heavens with blackness, and I make sackcloth their covering.
verses.web: I clothe the heavens with blackness. I make sackcloth their covering.”
verses.ct: "I dress the heavens in darkness and wrap them in sackcloth."

verses.kjv: The Lord GOD hath given me the tongue of the learned, that I should know how to speak a word in season to him that is weary: he wakeneth morning by morning, he wakeneth mine ear to hear as the learned.
verses.web: The Lord LORD has given me the tongue of those who are taught, that I may know how to sustain with words him who is weary. He awakens morning by morning, he awakens my ear to hear as those who are taught.
verses.ct: The Lord GOD has given me the words of someone well-taught, so I know how to speak an encouraging word to those who are weary. Every morning he wakes me and opens my ears to listen like a willing student.

verses.kjv: The Lord GOD hath opened mine ear, and I was not rebellious, neither turned away back.
verses.web: The Lord LORD has opened my ear. I was not rebellious. I have not turned back.
verses.ct: The Lord GOD opened my ears, and I didn't rebel or turn away.

verses.kjv: I gave my back to the smiters, and my cheeks to them that plucked off the hair: I hid not my face from shame and spitting.
verses.web: I gave my back to those who beat me, and my cheeks to those who plucked off the hair. I didn’t hide my face from shame and spitting.
verses.ct: I offered my back to those who beat me and my cheeks to those who ripped out my beard. I didn't hide my face from their mockery and spit.

verses.kjv: For the Lord GOD will help me; therefore shall I not be confounded: therefore have I set my face like a flint, and I know that I shall not be ashamed.
verses.web: For the Lord LORD will help me. Therefore I have not been confounded. Therefore I have set my face like a flint, and I know that I won’t be disappointed.
verses.ct: Because the Lord GOD helps me, I will not be disgraced. I've set my face like stone, and I know I won't be put to shame.

verses.kjv: He is near that justifieth me; who will contend with me? let us stand together: who is mine adversary? let him come near to me.
verses.web: He who justifies me is near. Who will bring charges against me? Let us stand up together. Who is my adversary? Let him come near to me.
verses.ct: The one who declares me innocent is near. Who dares to bring charges against me? Let them step forward. Who is my accuser? Let him come and face me.

verses.kjv: Behold, the Lord GOD will help me; who is he that shall condemn me? lo, they all shall wax old as a garment; the moth shall eat them up.
verses.web: Behold, the Lord LORD will help me! Who is he who will condemn me? Behold, they will all grow old like a garment. The moths will eat them up.
verses.ct: Look — the Lord GOD himself will help me! Who can condemn me? All my accusers will wear out like old clothes; moths will eat them away.

verses.kjv: Who is among you that feareth the LORD, that obeyeth the voice of his servant, that walketh in darkness, and hath no light? let him trust in the name of the LORD, and stay upon his God.
verses.web: Who among you fears LORD and obeys the voice of his servant? He who walks in darkness and has no light, let him trust in LORD’s name, and rely on his God.
verses.ct: If anyone among you fears the LORD and obeys the voice of his servant, yet walks through darkness with no light — let that person trust in the name of the LORD and rely on God.

verses.kjv: Behold, all ye that kindle a fire, that compass yourselves about with sparks: walk in the light of your fire, and in the sparks that ye have kindled. This shall ye have of mine hand; ye shall lie down in sorrow.
verses.web: Behold, all you who kindle a fire, who adorn yourselves with torches around yourselves, walk in the flame of your fire, and among the torches that you have kindled. You will have this from my hand: you will lie down in sorrow.
verses.ct: But watch out, all of you who light your own fires and surround yourselves with your own torches — go ahead, walk by the light of your own flames and the sparks you've kindled. This is what you'll receive from my hand: you will lie down in torment.
